alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 10:11AM MDT until May 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEASTERN ELBERT COUNTY... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...Noon to 6 pm MDT * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...Between 10 and 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will be likely to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
